greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of sequences (a_1, a_2, ..., a_n) of length n with a_1 = 1 satisfying a_i <= a_{i+1} <= 2*a_i.
comment: Number of n X n binary symmetric matrices with rows, considered as binary numbers, in nondecreasing order. - _R. H. Hardin_, May 30 2008
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..50
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} A097712(n, k). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 24 2004
Equals the binomial transform of A008934 (number of tournament sequences): a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} C(n, k)*A008934(k). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 18 2005
results.author: _Jeffrey Shallit_
